title: A group of state AGs calls for a national recall of high-theft Hyundai, Kia vehicles
description: Millions of vehicles manufactured by the companies between 2011 and 2022 can be easily hotwired and also lack engine immobilizers, a common anti-theft device.

title: NBCUniversal CEO Jeff Shell is out after an 'inappropriate relationship'
description: Shell apologized for an "inappropriate relationship with a woman in the company," and said he was "truly sorry" for letting down colleagues.

title: A South Florida man shot at 2 Instacart delivery workers who went to the wrong house
description: Broward County State Attorney Harold F. Pryor called the incident "very disturbing" and said prosecutors would decide whether to file charges after reviewing the case.

title: The Los Angeles mayor says she needs $1.3 billion to address homelessness in the city
description: Mayor Karen Bass says she told President Biden he could significantly reduce homelessness in the U.S. by helping to find shelter for the roughly 40,000 people in LA who are currently unhoused.

title: 39 bodies were found in the investigation of a cult in Kenya
description: The bodies were found on land owned by a pastor in coastal Kenya who was arrested for telling his followers to fast to death.

title: Homeware giant Bed Bath & Beyond has filed for bankruptcy
description: The retailer, which also owns the BuyBuy Baby chain, has lost shoppers and money after a series of ineffective or mistimed turnaround attempts. It has also exhausted numerous financial lifelines.

title: Unraveling a hidden cause of UTIs — plus how to prevent them
description: New research shows that one of the most common infections in women may be linked to our food supply. Here's what to know to protect yourself.

title: Indian police have arrested a Sikh separatist leader who had been on the run
description: Indian police have arrested a separatist leader who has revived calls for an independent Sikh homeland and the secession of India's northern Punjab state, which has a history of violent insurgency.

title: The NAACP is suing Mississippi over an expanded role for state-run police in Jackson
description: The NAACP says "separate and unequal policing" will return to Mississippi's majority-Black capital under a state-run police department.
